Content Element Detail (all declarations; defined in this component only; 3/3)
eInjury.01
Type:
anonymous (extension of icd10CodeInjury), simple content
Nillable:
(can be declared as nil using xsi:nil attribute in instance XML documents)
<nemsisTacDoc> <number>eInjury.01</number> <name>Cause of Injury</name> <national>Yes</national> <state>Yes</state> <definition>The category of the reported/suspected external cause of the injury.</definition> <v2Number>E10_01</v2Number> <usage>Required</usage> <performanceMeasuresGroup> <performanceMeasure>Trauma</performanceMeasure> </performanceMeasuresGroup> <comment> Suggested code list is represented in ICD-10-CM: T36.0xx through T65.91x, T71.11x through T71.9 and, V00.0x through Y38.9xx. It is not expected that EMS will utilize the 7th digit, often used to describe the type of encounter (A-Initial Encounter, D-Subsequent Encounter, S-Sequela). Thus, T, V and Y codes should be limited to 5 or 6 digits at the most. <br/><br/>Code list is represented in ICD-10 Codes. <br/>Website - http://uts.nlm.nih.gov <br/>Product - UMLS Metathesaurus </comment> <v3Changes/> </nemsisTacDoc>
Simple Content
xs:string
Pattern:
 (T71\.(([1][1-9]([0-9])?)|([2-8][0-9]{0,2})|[9]))|(T((36\.[0-9][0-9]{0,2})|([4-5][0-9]\.[0-9]{1,3})|(6[0-5]\.(([0-8][0-9]{0,2})|(9[0-1][0-9]{0,1})|([9][^0-9A-Za-z])))))|(([V-X][0-9]{2}\.[0-9][0-9]{0,2})|(Y(3[0-8]|[0-2][0-9])\.[0-9][0-9]{0,2}))

eInjury.03
Type:
anonymous (extension of TraumaCenterCriteria), simple content
Nillable:
(can be declared as nil using xsi:nil attribute in instance XML documents)
<nemsisTacDoc> <number>eInjury.03</number> <name>Trauma Center Criteria</name> <national>Yes</national> <state>Yes</state> <definition>Field Triage Criteria for transport to a trauma center as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American College of Surgeons-Committee on Trauma.</definition> <v2Number/> <usage>Required</usage> <performanceMeasuresGroup> <performanceMeasure>Trauma</performanceMeasure> </performanceMeasuresGroup> <comment>CDC Field Triage Decision Scheme - value choices for Steps 1 and 2. For falls, one story is equal to 10 feet.</comment> <v3Changes>Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2006 Field Triage Decision Scheme. <br/>Website: <a href="www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage">http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/</a></v3Changes> </nemsisTacDoc>
Simple Content
enumeration of xs:string
Enumeration:
"2903001"
 - 
 Amputation Proximal to Wrist and Ankle
"2903003"
 - 
 Crushed, Degloved, or Mangled Extremity
"2903005"
 - 
 Flail Chest
"2903007"
 - 
 Glasgow Coma Score less than 14
"2903009"
 - 
 Open or Depressed Skull Fracture
"2903011"
 - 
 Paralysis
"2903013"
 - 
 Pelvic Fracture(s)
"2903015"
 - 
 Penetrating Injury to Head, Neck, Torso, and Extremities Proximal to Elbow and Knee
"2903017"
 - 
 Respiratory Rate <10 or >29 OR (<20 in infant < one year)
"2903019"
 - 
 Systolic Blood Pressure less than 90
"2903021"
 - 
 Two or More Proximal Long-Bone Fractures

eInjury.04
Type:
anonymous (extension of VehicularInjuryIndicators), simple content
Nillable:
(can be declared as nil using xsi:nil attribute in instance XML documents)
<nemsisTacDoc> <number>eInjury.04</number> <name>Vehicular, Pedestrian, or Other Injury Risk Factor</name> <national>Yes</national> <state>Yes</state> <definition>The kind of risk factor predictors present at the incident</definition> <v2Number>E10_04</v2Number> <usage>Required</usage> <performanceMeasuresGroup> <performanceMeasure>Trauma</performanceMeasure> </performanceMeasuresGroup> <comment>Added additional mechanism or risk indicators based on CDC Field Triage Decision Scheme Steps 3.</comment> <v3Changes>Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS Field Triage Guideline.</v3Changes> <PNNil>Yes</PNNil> </nemsisTacDoc>
Simple Content
enumeration of xs:string
Enumeration:
"2904001"
 - 
 Auto v. Pedestrian/Bicyclist Thrown, Run Over, or > 20 MPH Impact
"2904003"
 - 
 Fall Adults: > 20 ft. (one story is equal to 10 ft.)
"2904005"
 - 
 Fall Children: > 10 ft. or 2-3 times the height of the child
"2904007"
 - 
 Crash Death in Same Passenger Compartment
"2904009"
 - 
 Crash Ejection (partial or complete) from vehicle
"2904011"
 - 
 Crash Intrusion: > 12 in. occupant site; > 18 in. any site
"2904013"
 - 
 Crash Vehicle Telemetry Data (AACN) Consistent with High Risk of Injury
"2904015"
 - 
 Motorcycle Crash > 20 MPH
